column1: Table 2: Age-standardised avoidable mortality rates by sex, cause and constituent country of the UK, 2014 to 20161,2,3,4,5,6
Source: Office for National Statistics, Northern Ireland Statistics and Research Agency, National Records of Scotland
1 Figures are for deaths registered in each calendar year.
2 Deaths of non-residents are excluded in figures for England, Northern Ireland and Wales and included in figures for Scotland.
3 Age-standardised mortality rates are expressed per 100,000 population and standardised to the 2013 European Standard Population.
4 See the 'Definition' tab for further details of the underlying causes of death included.
5 The 'Other' cause group consists of nutritional, endocrine and metabolic disorders, neurological disorders, digestive disorders, genitourinary disorders, and maternal and infant conditions.

6 Age-standardised mortality rates based on fewer than 10 deaths are not presented due to low reliability and marked as ':'; figures based on 10 to 19 deaths are presented, but marked with 'u' to show low reliability
